programme.desc: Family means everything to this musician and her Los Angeles home is where they all come together. However, the cramped flow and uneven floors make it tough for her sister to move around, so Drew and Jonathan open things up.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Home
programme.desc: A couple loves the vintage character and features of their 1940s Los Angeles home, but its closed-off layout is no longer functional for their growing family, and they need the brothers to open up the layout.

programme.title: DIY SOS: The Big Build
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team call on the local community to renovate the home of Rob and Michelle Wall and their son Noah, who suffers from spina bifida.

programme.title: MasterChef Australia: Back to Win
programme.desc: Its the very first day of Sweet Week, and the remaining contestants must take their cue from a very gooey mystery box lift and incorporate an element of goo into a dessert.

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Hannah and Mike help a man writhing in agony after having his kidney stones removed; Shane makes animals out of his surgical gloves to distract a toddler who became injured after falling off a trampoline.

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Sleeps Over
programme.desc: We meet single mum-of-eight Marie Buchan, a lightning rod in the fierce debate over the UK benefits system who has openly shared her state-funded lifestyle.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: The City Addicted to Crystal Meth
programme.desc: Louis Theroux visits Fresno in California to take a look at how crystal meth addiction is affecting the local community. As he infiltrates the town, he experiences the reality of meth abuse, with addicts inviting him into their homes to see them take hit after hit of their favourite drug. He also talks to the local police and sees the work being done to combat the destruction caused.

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: The Auckland Rescue Helicopter crew are dispatched to a critical situation when a drag racer smashes into a concrete wall at 225kph.

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: Four people are left fighting to keep their heads above water when their boat sinks in the Firth of Thames.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Experts Henry Cole and Simon OBrien travel the length of Britain to find, fix and flog unwanted possessions on behalf of their owners. A butter churn, a slot machine and a set of print trays are among the finds in this episode.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exlporing a desert island with an infected past which lies adrift from the US mainland, the brutalist palace built on the orders of a mad Bulgarian dictator, and a doomed top-secret Nazi project.

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael embarks on a rail journey from the Thar Desert in Rajasthan to the Indian capital, taking in desert landscapes and dazzling historic palaces. From Jodhpur, Michael strikes out into the desert, taking a camel ride to a village where life has changed little in centuries, before embarking on the Jaipur-Agra-Delhi `Golden Triangle tour, Indias must-do itinerary in 1913 as today.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Presenting the latest products live on television that can be ordered directly. The product range extends from vacuum cleaners and bath towels to sports equipment.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the post-war Britain of his youth in a journey from the Midlands to the West Country. Beginning in Derbys railway works, Michael hears how the Victorian sheds now house some of the most modern assembly lines in Britain.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Coventry, Michael recalls the destruction by the German Luftwaffe of the citys gothic cathedral in November 1940. Heading south to Royal Leamington Spa, Michael visits the Guide Dogs for the Blind National Centre, established in the town in 1941.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos railway journey reaches the heart of Warwickshire. In the Tudor town of Stratford-upon-Avon, birthplace of William Shakespeare, Michael visits the Royal Shakespeare Theatre, home since 1961 to the Royal Shakespeare Company.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: At the African and Caribbean Heritage Centre in Wolverhampton, Michael finds out about the impact of Enoch Powells 1968 speech on immigration. In Kidderminster, he discovers the site of a secret wartime enterprise known as the Drakelow Tunnels.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek makes his way to Blackpool to pick up what will be the highest priced item at the next auction. But, unfortunately the 1970s Aston Martin DBS needs a tow to the local garage.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Over the years, Derek has learnt to always expect the unexpected. So when Call the Midwife star, Cliff Parisi, drops off his Bedford CA campervan, its just another day at the office.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The German occupation of Hungary leads to the deportation of Jews living there. The Western Allies debate whether to bomb the camp. More people are murdered at Auschwitz in 1944, than in all previous years.

programme.title: Adolf Hitlers War
programme.desc: As Hitlers troops advance into the Soviet Union, occupied regions in Ukraine, Belarus and Poland face the brunt of Nazi cruelty at the same time as the Nazi camp system is established.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The team return to Waltham Forest Town Hall where a busy day reveals an art deco pendant with a hint of ancient Egypt, a haul of charming tiles discovered behind a chimney and a purse that saved the life of a German soldier in the First World War.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona and the team visit the Liverpool Metropolitan Cathedral, where treasures include a miniature kitchen range, a piece of the citys heritage found in a French flea market and a sextant used at sea in the race to rescue survivors of the Titanic.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team opt to buy one of the most affordable sports cars on the road: the Mazda MX-5.
